author: Scott Patterson
title: Glencore Doubles Down on Coal With $1.7 Billion Australian Investment
text:
LONDON—Glencore PLC added to its growing portfolio of coal assets with a $1.7 billion investment in a pair of Australian producers—part of a bet by the mining giant that demand for coal in Southeast Asia will remain strong, even as competitors shy away from the stuff.

The Swiss mining and trading giant said it acquired Rio Tinto PLC’s 82% interest in the Hail Creek coal mine and adjacent coal resources, as well as its 71.2% interest in the Valeria coal resource. The deal follows Glencore’s purchase last year of a 49% stake...
